title: How can Kog compete against other Adcs?
body:
Every time I face a Jinx, Corki, or a Vayne it feels like they excel at doing what Kog does only they do it way better. I don't even know what identity Riot wants to push on Kog because it feels like he is trying to fill 3 different niches, but isn't top of the dog pile in any of them.  Vayne shreds tanks so much better than Kog, Jinx is the better late game carry and doesn't have her range modifier gated by a long cooldown, Corki brings a stronger magic damage influence to a team and overall better synergy with trinity force, and to top it all off they don't suffer from an absolute dog shit laning phase. 

500 base range means you get creep blocked half the time you want last hit without your W. Kog can't follow ganks well he can't run away from ganks well. He can't poke with his ult anymore. Every other adc has decent Ad scaling on every ability and Kog is a complete slave to attack speed. How does Riot look at Kog and say "Yep this is fine everything is fine." 

What does Kog do that other adcs can't besides explode when he dies? Is that the niche Riot wants him to fill shittiest passive on a Marksman? Clearly not because Kalista has him beat in that regard as well.

Edit: A common thing Im hearing is "OMG dat late game doe, but only if you are on a team with 4 supports who buff you constantly wipe your ass and hold your hand" and that argument really just goes for all marksmen. Teams should peel for their carries and amplify their damage when able. Kog is just special in that he gets dusted by a stiff breeze if you aren't protecting him.

That would be a ham-fisted solution, but still a solution.

In exchange for his vulnerability (no hard-CC, mobility, durability), Kog'maw is a massive damage threat.  Taking a quick look, his kit provides:

* A passive attack speed steroid
* A percentage armor and MR reduction
* Range increase
* Percentage health magic-damage
* A relatively spammable (pseudo-)execute
---------------
From one perspective, you have to build a team around him to protect him for him to work properly.  This, in itself, can be considered a weakness since it means he has to rely heavily on his allies to function properly and is rather helpless when left alone.

However, you can look at it another way: Kog'maw is the only damage source truly required by his team.  He will tear through the enemy team if left untouched and he is rather difficult to build against.  As such, he is a great champion to pick when your team composition has relatively low damage and high durability/utility.
--------------
While one could argue that he is difficult to itemize penetration for (due to his mixed physical and magic damage), it isn't really that bad.  Even ignoring his Q, you can easily itemize armor penetration (Last Whisper) and let your magic damage stand for itself; even without magic penetration, tanks can have trouble effectively itemizing for both armor and magic resistance (and stacking health is a horrible idea against Kog'maw).

If you want to compare him against the other ADCs you mentioned:

{{champion:42}} Kog'maw brings far higher sustained damage from a safer range in the mid- and late-game.  Corki is rather burst and poke oriented which can result in him having issues dealing with tanks properly.

{{champion:67}} Vayne is a better duelist and arguably kills an enemy tank faster (provided they can keep procing their Silver Bolts).  However, Kog'maw is far better at killing multiple enemy tanks simultaneously due to the synergy between W, Blade of the Ruined King and Runaan's Hurricane.

{{champion:222}} While Jinx's range-modifier isn't gated by a cooldown (and the AoE splash damage is fantastic), she does sacrifice raw attack speed to use it.  While Jinx has fairly low base attack speed in Rocket Form, Kog'maw's attack speed and is unaffected and his Q's passive steroid remains in effect.

Kog should be all about melting people with his digestive fluid and growing into a late game power. He's a baby and he wants to eat anything he can so he can fill his hunger and grow. The growth fantasy comes from his late game power but currently his eating and dissolving fantasy isn't nearly as pronounced. His W with the max health damage gives some of this feel and his Q shred does too but the Q spell doesn't fell that great and its effects aren't obvious unless used on a late game tank.

So what we want are abilities that would help contribute to these fantasies while also feeling good to use. His passive, while it has a rationale for existing, doesn't feel good since it's only ever used in the worst case scenario. His ult could also use some reworking to make it fit the fantasy too.

I'm in agreement there.

I've got a two pronged concept for the 'dissolving' side of things.  First, Kog gets a new Passive that applies stacks of flat resistance shred to targets when Kog hits them with basic attacks.  I used to run a magic resist shredding Kog back when his Q did flat shred and the result tended to be pretty hilarious.  He could knock soft targets down into negative resist and absolutely annihilate them.

The second portion would be Kog's Q.  Kog's Q would have its cooldown decreased considerably and it would no longer shred any resist.  Instead, it could place a debuff on targets hit that converts Kog's passive stacks from flat shred to multiplicative percentile shred stacks.  Each stack would be counted separately and if the percentile value is less than the flat value, the flat value is used instead.  Basically, Kog's passive would be the minimum shred caused by each stack.

Now for the BIG idea.

Kog's Ult?  Each level in it causes Kog to transform ala Kha'zix.  Kog grows up through the game, becoming bigger and more ferocious looking until you've got a real end-game monster.  It would fit SO PERFECTLY with Kog's fantasy of being this cute little Void caterpillar that grows up into an unstoppable horror by late game.
Would certainly help to set him apart. His passive and Q definitely feel like huge blanks in his Kit.
